body_html:
Hi,
I'm facing a version issue trying to compile tensorflow-1.11.0 in order to use it in a C++ project. I think the issue is that bazel use protobuf-3.6.0 in tensorflow/workspace.bzl but the tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh fetch version 3.5.0 thus when you follow the instructions where you copy the proto stuff in Tensorflow's install_dir, we get a version mismatch.

tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh needs to be updated to match tensorflow/workspace.bzl.
body_text:
Hi,
I'm facing a version issue trying to compile tensorflow-1.11.0 in order to use it in a C++ project.  I think the issue is that bazel use protobuf-3.6.0 in tensorflow/workspace.bzl but the tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh fetch version 3.5.0 thus when you follow the instructions where you copy the proto stuff in Tensorflow's install_dir, we get a version mismatch.
tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh needs to be updated to match tensorflow/workspace.bzl.
body:
Hi,
  I'm facing a version issue trying to compile tensorflow-1.11.0 in order to use it in a C++ project.  I think the issue is that bazel use protobuf-3.6.0 in `tensorflow/workspace.bzl` but the `tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh` fetch version 3.5.0 thus when you follow the [instructions](https://tuatini.me/building-tensorflow-as-a-standalone-project/) where you copy the proto stuff in Tensorflow's install_dir, we get a version mismatch.

`tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh` needs to be updated to match `tensorflow/workspace.bzl`.
